data.title: Good food and service with a neat atmosphere.
data.text: We go regularly and enjoy the food, service  and atmosphere. There burgers are really good. The name fits it perfectly because it has that neighborhood feel!

data.title: Great food, great price
data.text: This is a fantastic little place to eat and enjoy a grown-up beverage.  I've eaten here a million times since I was a kid, and always felt comfortable.  If they'd take down some of that Michigan stuff, I'd say I even felt like I was "home".  Still, have the fried green peppers, and the sliders - they are delicious.  Great prices, even if the tap list is short. We will always love Your Neighbors!

data.title: A Real Gem
data.text: Lovely place with lovely people.  The staff are excellent - very friendly.  Great atmosphere.  The 3 TV's over the bar are just right and not intrusive - you can still strike up a good conversation at the bar.  One of my favorite places to hang out

data.title: A Real Find!
data.text: My husband and I have lived in Naperville for over 20 years and have never been to this restaurant.  We went about 6 weeks ago, and have been back 3 times since.  It will be one of our favorites for times to come.  The atmosphere is great - sort of sporty but really mostly family.  The energy in the restaurant is very positive and lively.  There are plenty of choices for food but the hamburgers are great and so are the fish and chips.  The service in only EXCELLENT.  There are specials every night which are very reasonable.  We love this place!

data.title: Very good atmosphere and food!
data.text:
I stop here when I can.  And whenever I do, I always have an enjoyable time.  

I stopped in for lunch.  As usual, the service is always friendly and good. Though it is a bar, it still is family friendly at all hours.   

I enjoy there food and my recent visit was no different. I ordered the Reuben and the soup.  They have very good soups here.   Thr prices for food and drinks are always reasonable.  Their menu has something for everyone and their daily specials are very good. It is a nice neighborhood hangout for people of all ages.

data.title: Whenever I'm in Naperville I always return here.
data.text: I have been going by myself, with family and friends, and for business to Neighbors for over 20 years.  Always the best.  Atmosphere, Food, Service, Chat, Chill out with Rick, Deb, and Company.  Local Pub sports bar of the best kind.  You will always be treated like a king or queen.  The food and drink specials should be considered first, but don't overlook the menu.   I've had most of it.  The Pork Sandwich is my favorite, followed by the Burger.  But, everything is always good.  Monster selection of Beers.  Enjoy.

data.title: Tuesday Night Tenderloins!
data.text:
This is definitely a local hangout and not many visitors will ever see the inside of this place.  It is tucked away in a strip center next to the Secretary of State's office for licensing automobiles.

We always go on Tuesday nights because they offer breaded tenderloin sandwiches.  This is an Indiana, Iowa, Southern Illinois delicacy that cannot traditionally be had outside that geography.  The sandwich consists of pork that has been hammered down to a sliver and then breaded and deep fried.  It is the only sandwich I eat with just pickles and mustard.  They do a very nice job here.

The fries are typically very good, with crinkles and fried crisp just the way I like them.

They have a nice variety of beer available including some from popular micro-breweries in the area.  Cheap commericial beer as well.

No complaints about the burgers when I can't go on Tuesday, you will feel welcome by a staff that has worked there a long time and comfortable just grabbing a meal or a drink.

data.title: great little "hole in the wall!"
data.text: It's tucked away in a recessed corner of a strip mall, right next to the Secretary of  Stste's office.  The atmosphere is very casual, on the low-lit side, with sports banners hanging all around.  If you want a good sandwich or burger, this is the place for you!  We got there just before 6p, and we're seated right away.  But within a few minutes there were several people waiting for a table.  It's a popular place and I can see why.  We'll definitely go back.

data.title: Where the locals go for decent food and drinks
data.text: Here's a local place that's not on the radar of many people but it's been there for a long time and hopefully will stay too.  The food is average, maybe a bit above on certain items.  The staff is always friendly and the place does get busy from 6pm to 8pm.  The decor is college football and there are plenty of TVs to watch the games.  They have a large bar in the middle of the restaurant, so that's on option too to watch and have some cold ones.  You'll find families with young kids to seniors having a nice dinner there.  You won't find many single people looking to meet other singles, just not that kind of place!  The only negative I have with the place is their lighting.  It's so, so dark in there.  Not sure if they're trying to hide something like dirty floors or walls.  They have daily dinner specials at very reasonable prices.  Friday fish fry is not too bad.  Try it!
